definition: Portugal/Portuguese/abbr. for 葡萄牙[Pu2 tao2 ya2]

sentences.english: And two long glasses brimmed with muscatel Bubble upon the table.
sentences.chinese: 桌上兩個長腳玻璃盅注滿了麝香葡萄酒，泛着泡沫。

sentences.english: They had pears in white wine, with a piece of fruitcake.
sentences.chinese: 他們喫着白葡萄酒醃泡過的梨子，配着水果蛋糕。

sentences.english: From a small Spanish province called La Rioja come HUARTE wines.
sentences.chinese: 來自西班牙里奧哈地區的HUARTE葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Yes, I have a bottle of Chablis.
In the South-East part of the complex there was a wine presser.
sentences.chinese: 遺蹟的西南部是一個葡萄酒加工廠。

sentences.english: Some years Non-Vintage can be more fun.
sentences.chinese: 一些年頭，非葡萄酒釀造會更有趣。

sentences.english: I always add a little Madeira to the liquid when I stew prunes.
sentences.chinese: 在燉李子時我常加些馬德拉葡萄酒在湯裏。

sentences.english: Medium-bodied in deep ruby red color.
sentences.chinese: 中度酒體葡萄酒，呈深寶石紅色澤。

sentences.english: Judy Garland, he recalls, was also fond of a tipple(9).
sentences.chinese: 據他回憶，茱蒂嘉蘭也很喜歡烈性葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Australian Shiraz is also a model of wine.
sentences.chinese: 也是澳洲穗樂仙葡萄酒的典範。

sentences.english: Produced only in the village of Saint-Estèphe, the wines of the appellation carry the mark of a territory.
sentences.chinese: 這個產區生產的葡萄酒成爲一個區域的標誌。

sentences.english: Medium full-bodied dry red wine in dark ruby color.
sentences.chinese: 中度至豐滿酒體乾紅葡萄酒，深寶石紅色澤。

sentences.english: dry red table wine from the Rioja region of northern Spain.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙北部里奧哈地區進餐時引用的乾紅葡萄酒。

sentences.english: The wine from Côtes de Bourg is quite tannic with strong aromas of red fruits.
sentences.chinese: 波爾山坡的葡萄酒就着強烈的果香而且收縮感強。

sentences.english: In the popular and the young white wines, you can find the aroma of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在流行且淺齡的白葡萄酒裏，你可以找到發酵的香氣。

sentences.english: The Pomerol wine can be more robust than others in Bordeaux.
sentences.chinese: 龐馬魯葡萄酒比其他波爾多酒更爲濃烈。

definition: Cognac/brandy 白蘭地|白兰地[bai2 lan2 di4] from the Cognac region of southwest France
to brew/to make (wine, vinegar, soybean paste etc) by fermentation
Burgundy (Bourgogne), kingdom during medieval period, now region of France
